title: Adult Children Of Emotionally Immature Parents
author: Lindsay C. Gibson
description:
If you grew up with an emotionally immature, unavailable, or selfish parent, you may have lingering feelings of anger, loneliness, betrayal, or abandonment. You may recall your childhood as a time when your emotional needs were not met, when your feelings were dismissed, or when you took on adult levels of responsibility in an effort to compensate for your parent’s behavior. These wounds can be healed, and you can move forward in your life.

In this breakthrough book, clinical psychologist Lindsay Gibson exposes the destructive nature of parents who are emotionally immature or unavailable. You will see how these parents create a sense of neglect, and discover ways to heal from the pain and confusion caused by your childhood. By freeing yourself from your parents’ emotional immaturity, you can recover your true nature, control how you react to them, and avoid disappointment. Finally, you’ll learn how to create positive, new relationships so you can build a better life.

Discover the four types of difficult parents:
The emotional parent instills feelings of instability and anxiety
The driven parent stays busy trying to perfect everything and everyone
The passive parent avoids dealing with anything upsetting
The rejecting parent is withdrawn, dismissive, and derogatory

description: The second book in the Lo Blacklock series. Blacklock attends the opening of a luxury Swiss hotel and gets swept up in a dangerous pursuit across Europe.

title: The Mission

title: Every Summer After

title: Problematic Summer Romance

title: The Nine

description: During World War II, a group of women escaped from a death march and made their way back to Paris.

title: Another
author: Paul Tremblay
description: Casey Wilson meets a mysterious creature that’s taking over his life. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: Grumpy Monkey
author: Suzanne Lang
description: Jim Panzee is having a bad day. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: The Inheritance Games
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
description: Avery Grambs tries to figure out why an inheritance from a stranger was bestowed upon her. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: A Treachery Of Swans
author: A.B. Poranek
description: A gothic fantasy inspired by "Swan Lake." (Ages 14 and up)

title: Rebel Witch

title: A Forgery Of Fate

title: Caught Up
author: Navessa Allen
description: The second book of the Into Darkness series. Nico “Junior” Trocci and Lauren Marchetti become ensnared in a game of seduction. Read by Teddy Hamilton, Kasi Hollowell and Jason June. 10 hours, 41 minutes unabridged.

title: Never Flinch
author: Stephen King
description: Holly Gibney does double duty by helping head off acts of retribution and protecting a women’s rights activist. Read by Jessie Mueller and the author. 14 hours, 44 minutes unabridged.

title: Lights Out
author: Navessa Allen
description: As Aly and Josh live out their dark fantasies, someone with sinister intentions impinges on them. Read by Elena Wolfe and Jacob Morgan. 13 hours, 38 minutes unabridged.

title: Nightshade
author: Michael Connelly
description: The Los Angeles County sheriff's detective Stilwell gets reassigned to Catalina Island, where he investigates a poaching case and a Jane Doe found in the harbor. Read by Will Damron. 9 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.

title: Iron Flame
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training might require her to betray the man she loves. Read by Rebecca Soler and Teddy Hamilton. 28 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.

title: Original Sin
author: Jake Tapper and Alex Thompson
description: An account of Joe Biden’s initial decision to run for re-election in 2024 and its numerous consequences. Read by Jake Tapper. 8 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.

title: How Countries Go Broke
author: Ray Dalio
description: The author of “Principles” evaluates the forces that contribute to what he calls the “big debt cycle.” Read by Jeremy Bobb and the author. 10 hours unabridged.

title: A Clean Mess
author: Tiffany Jenkins
description: Jenkins recounts her journey from being incarcerated to becoming a sober mother of three children. Read by the author. 7 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.

title: How To Lose Your Mother
author: Molly Jong-Fast
description: A contributing writer at Vanity Fair and podcast host describes her relationship with her mother, Erica Jong. Read by the author. 6 hours, 55 minutes unabridged.

title: Not My Type
author: E. Jean Carroll
description: The journalist shares moments from her life and the two trials in which she accused President Trump of sexual assault and defamation. Read by the author. 12 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.

title: Matriarch
author: Tina Knowles with Kevin Carr O'Leary
description: The businesswoman, who is the mother of Beyoncé Knowles-Carter and Solange Knowles, traces her life’s journey. Read by Tina Knowles, Beyoncé, Solange, Kelly Rowland and Angie Beyincé. 17 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.

title: Apple In China
author: Patrick McGee
description: A journalist depicts the development of Apple’s supply chain and its increasingly precarious relationship with China.

title: My Hero Academia, Vol. 41
author: Kohei Horikoshi
description: Time is running out to stop the All for One’s schemes and the battle between Midoriya and Shigaraki reaches a peak.

title: Dandadan, Vol. 13
author: Yukinobu Tatsu
description: Momo Ayase and her allies face aliens who have attacked another planet out in deep space.

title: The Cartoonists Club
author: Raina Telgemeier and Scott McCloud
description: Four kids with different creative strengths come together to learn about making comics.

title: Dog Man Unleashed
author: Dav Pilkey
description: The second book in the Dog Man series. Petey the Cat’s criminal curiosity causes trouble.

title: Rage Of Eagles
author: William W. Johnstone
description: The fifth of the Eagles series. Falcon MacCallister goes after the Noonan gang for the murder of his father.

title: Alex Cross Must Die
author: James Patterson
description: The 32nd book in the Alex Cross series. When a jet is gunned down, Cross goes back into action.

title: On The Royle Range
author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
description: The third book in the Forever Texas series. As the country splits apart, Regis Royle leads a precarious cattle drive.

title: The Wild Side
author: Fern Michaels
description: A former government agent who became a school guidance counselor receives a request to return for a specialized assignment.

title: The Sheriff Takes A Wife
author: Debbie Macomber
description: A woman from the city and a small-town sheriff develop a relationship that comes with complications.

title: Sunset
author: Sharon Sala
description: A bull rider who was badly injured on the rodeo circuit begins a relationship with a waitress with a hidden talent for painting.

title: Hidden Pictures
author: Jason Rekulak
description: A 5-year-old’s disturbing artwork may hold clues to an unsolved murder.

title: Stuart Woods' Golden Hour
author: Brett Battles
description: The seventh book in the Teddy Fay series. A film’s European press tour serves as cover for Fay to find out who is killing C.I.A. agents.

title: Standing Watch
author: Terri Reed
description: The third book in the Dakota K-9 Unit series. A park ranger witnesses a co-worker’s murder.

title: Saving Her Amish Baby
author: Jo Ann Brown
description: The second book in the Amish of Lost River series. An Amish seamstress takes in her cousin’s abandoned baby.

title: Following The Clues
author: Dana Mentink
description: The fourth book in the Security Hounds Investigations series. A K-9 handler searches for a childhood friend’s mother who went missing.

title: I'M Here To Kill You
author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
description: Two western stories: “Brutal Night of the Mountain Man” and “Venom of the Mountain Man.”

title: A Minecraft Movie: The Junior Novelization
author: adapted by David Lewman

title: Alone
author: Megan E. Freeman
description:
When twelve-year-old Maddie hatches a scheme for a secret sleepover with her two best friends, she ends up waking up to a nightmare. She’s alone—left behind in a town that has been mysteriously evacuated and abandoned.

With no one to rely on, no power, and no working phone lines or internet access, Maddie slowly learns to survive on her own. Her only companions are a Rottweiler named George and all the books she can read. After a rough start, Maddie learns to trust her own ingenuity and invents clever ways to survive in a place that has been deserted and forgotten.

She escapes natural disasters, looters, and wild animals as the months' pass. But Maddie’s most formidable enemy is the crushing loneliness she faces every day. Can Maddie’s stubborn will to survive carry her through the most frightening experience of her life?

title: A Study In Drowning
author: Ava Reid
description:
Effy has always believed in fairy tales. She's had no choice. Since childhood, she's been haunted by visions of the Fairy King. She's found solace only in the pages of Angharad - a beloved epic about a mortal girl who falls in love with the Fairy King, and then destroys him.

Effy's tattered copy is all that's keeping her afloat through her stifling first term her prestigious architecture college. So when the late author's family announces a contest to design his house, Effy fells certain this is her destiny.

But Hiraeth Manor is an impossible task: a musty, decrepit estate on the brink of crumbling into a hungry sea. And when Effy arrives, she finds she isn't the only one who's made a temporary home there. Preston Héloury, a stodgy young literature scholar, is studying Myrddin's papers and is determined to prove her favourite author is a fraud.

As the two rival students investigate the reclusive author's legacy, piecing together clues through his letters, books, and diaries, they discover that the house's foundation isn't the only thing that can't be trusted. There are dark forces, both mortal and magical, conspiring against them - and the truth may bring them both to ruin.

title: Betting On You
author: Lynn Painter
description:
When seventeen-year-old Bailey starts a new job at a hotel waterpark, she is less than thrilled to see an old acquaintance is one of her coworkers. Bailey met Charlie a year ago on the long flight to Omaha, where she moved after her parents’ divorce. Charlie’s cynicism didn’t mix well with Bailey’s carefully well-behaved temperament, and his endless commentary was the irritating cherry on top of an already emotionally fraught trip.

Now, Bailey and Charlie are still polar opposites, but instead of everything about him rubbing Bailey the wrong way, she starts to look forward to hanging out and gossiping about the waterpark guests and their coworkers—particularly two who keep flirting with each other. Bailey and Charlie make a bet on whether or not the cozy pair will actually get together. Charlie insists that members of the opposite sex can’t just be friends, and Bailey is determined to prove him wrong.

Bailey and Charlie keep close track of the romantic progress of others while Charlie works to deflect the growing feelings he’s developed for Bailey. Terrified to lose her if his crush becomes known, what doesn’t help his agenda is Bailey and Charlie “fake dating” in order to disrupt the annoying pleasantries between Bailey’s mom and her mom’s new boyfriend. Soon, what Charlie was hoping to avoid becomes a reality as Bailey starts to see him as not only a friend she can rely on in the midst of family drama—but someone who makes her hands shake and heart race. But Charlie has a secret—a secret that involves Bailey and another bet Charlie may have made. Can the two make a real go of things…or has Charlie’s secret doomed them before they could start?

title: A Witch'S Guide To Magical Innkeeping
author: Sangu Mandanna
description: A witch, who helps run her great aunt’s enchanted inn, enlists a historian’s aid to regain her magic.

title: Three Shattered Souls
author: Mai Corland
description: The third book in the Broken Blades series. Allegiances are upended as the Blades face new threats.

title: Onyx Storm
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.

title: Jfk
author: J. Randy Taraborrelli
description: The author of “Jackie” provides a portrait of the public and private sides of President John F. Kennedy.

title: Algospeak
author: Adam Aleksic
description: A linguist and content creator known as the “Etymology Nerd” delineates the impact of internet algorithms on language and communication.

title: On Her Game
author: Christine Brennan
description: A sports columnist for USA Today profiles the ascendance of the sports and cultural icon Caitlin Clark.

title: No More Tears
author: Gardiner Harris
description: The investigative journalist brings to light the corporate practices of the pharmaceutical company Johnson & Johnson.

title: The Girl I Was
author: Jeneva Rose
description: After a breakup and the loss of her job, Alexis wakes up in her college town in the year 2002 and comes across her 18-year-old self.

title: The Unraveling Of Julia
author: Lisa Scottoline
description: Julia Pritzker encounters strange and deadly things when she goes to claim the Tuscan villa and vineyard she inherited from a stranger.

title: The Irresistible Urge To Fall For Your Enemy
author: Brigitte Knightley
description: Aurienne Fairhrim accepts an offer to heal a member of an enemy faction and an attraction develops.

title: Behind The Badge
author: Johnny Joey Jones
description: The Fox News military analyst extols the first responders among his friends and family.

author: Josh Dawsey, Tyler Pager and Isaac Arnsdorf
description: Journalists from The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times and The Washington Post examine the most recent presidential election campaign.

title: Just For The Summer
author: Abby Jimenez
description: Justin and Emma, whose exes find soulmates after breaking up with them, have a fling on a private island on Lake Minnetonka.

title: The British Are Coming
author: Rick Atkinson
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning historian and journalist begins his Revolution Trilogy with events from 1775 to 1777.
